result.execSummary:
The defendant Damon L. Early was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Expunction will be granted upon successful completion of probation.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees. 
** Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges. Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharges.  Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  DOC shall promptly notify the court, in writing,  of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

supervisions.notes: PROBATION HAS BEEN REVOKED.  TO COMMENCE FORTHWITH.  Huber allowed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Damon L. Early

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Barth.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court imposes sentence of 1 year jail w/Huber privileges, concurrent with 13CM1708 & 14CM1438; credit for 79 days served.
Atty  M Barth
At the request of DOC Agt Adriane Wilder a SEHR is set for 1/25/16 at 1:30pm.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Kristyne Watson.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for one year.  See conditions.  Appeal rights.  DNA ordered; notice given to deft.  Bond shall be applied to costs - balance to be returned to poster.  Expunction will be granted upon successful completion of probation.
Re:Memo re:Probation Progress
Clerk Lehman sent an email to Atty Watson inquiring on whether she still needed a bond motion hrg; deft's sentencing hrg is 9/25/15.

for Bond Modification - filed by defense.  The maximum amount of bond is $1,000 cash.  The court previously amended the deft's bond to $2500 cash.  After reviewing the moving papers, the court amends the bond to $1,000 cash with the same conditions.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Kristyne Watson.  Case is resolved.  Victim rights compliance.  Deft pleads guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Admits to repeater.  Court wants to review the PSI from the deft's previous file as well as a request an update from deft's agent.  Sentencing set for 9/25/15 @ 10am.  Court amends deft's bond to $2500 cash - same conditions.  Deft taken into custody.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
